item.source: Having problems with my jar file!Cannot find main class:gui when sent

item.title: Having problems with my jar file!Cannot find main class:gui when sent
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“zach55200, post:28, topic:417090”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=519028.msg3774701#msg3774701 date=1318002759]

Use jdk 24, 25 or even 26 doesnt matter honestly just anything but jdk7/jre7 anyways replace your run.bat with this

[quote]@echo off
Title Client
cd ./
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit[/quote]

replace your compiler with this

[quote]@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause[/quote]

Now, delete EVERY class file then compile using those settings and re jar the client. should work

Did you just suggest he not use Java 7? Why?
[/quote]

Seriously? de rep me because i told him what to do and it would work?
I told him to do that because the server cant read jdk1.7.0 thats rediculous.
If you read my directions and follow them it WILL work i had the same problem.[/quote]
You should check your rep record, I have never de-repped you, and your wrong, jdk1.7.0 would work, as long as his computer is compatible with it.

Read full topic

Use jdk 24, 25 or even 26 doesnt matter honestly just anything but jdk7/jre7 anyways replace your run.bat with this

[quote]@echo off
Title Client
cd ./
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit[/quote]

replace your compiler with this

[quote]@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause[/quote]

Now, delete EVERY class file then compile using those settings and re jar the client. should work
[/quote]
Did you just suggest he not use Java 7? Why?[/quote]

Seriously? de rep me because i told him what to do and it would work?
I told him to do that because the server cant read jdk1.7.0 thats rediculous.
If you read my directions and follow them it WILL work i had the same problem.

item.source: Having problems with my jar file!Cannot find main class:gui when sent

item.title: Having problems with my jar file!Cannot find main class:gui when sent
item.dc:creator: @zach55200 zach55200
item.description:
@zach55200 wrote:

Use jdk 24, 25 or even 26 doesnt matter honestly just anything but jdk7/jre7 anyways replace your run.bat with this

@echo off Title Client cd ./ "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 exit

replace your compiler with this

@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

Now, delete EVERY class file then compile using those settings and re jar the client. should work

Read full topic

item.title: Having problems with my jar file!Cannot find main class:gui when sent
item.dc:creator: @demps2k9 demps2k9
item.description:
@demps2k9 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:15, topic:417090”][quote author=demps2k9 link=topic=519028.msg3772773#msg3772773 date=1317847595]
Change: 127.0.0.1
To your server ip in the Gui.java
[/quote]
Why would it be the ip,?

Make a new .txt file called Manifest and put this i think in there…

Manifest: Gui [/quote]

Because when I used PI and someone connected to the server, it would dc at random times if I left that ip at 127.0.0.1

Read full topic

item.title: Having problems with my jar file!Cannot find main class:gui when sent
item.dc:creator: @saadmboy saadmboy
item.description:
@saadmboy wrote:

zizzle14:

i made the jar file so i could send to people and they could play my server but when they try to open it say “cannot find main class:gui program will exit”

You are using Insidia client, right?
Well, the Insidia client was compiled using jdk7 and needs Java 7 to work…I had a similar problem (it wouldn’t work on my computer) but after upgrading to Java 7 (jre7) everything was fine…

Read full topic
